With hurricane season in full swing, homeowners, renters and business owners should consider purchasing a flood insurance policy now.

.@wectnews highlighted legislation I co-sponsored that was passed by the House last night. It makes it easier for taxpayers to see how federal disaster aid dollars are being spent. WATCH HERE: pic.twitter.com/h8H4UXhosw

Just passed by the House: legislation I sponsored with @RepMarkMeadows that improves federal disaster assistance programs by increasing transparency & requiring agencies offering disaster aid to report data to  http://USASpending.Gov .
 
More transparency = more accountability. pic.twitter.com/jR1xZaYIgB

Six months into the 116th Congress, it's clear Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats are not pursuing an agenda that aligns with the values of North Carolina families.

All nine counties in #NC07 include at least one Opportunity Zone, all being prime candidates for job growth, revitalization & investment – particularly as we continue to rebuild from Hurricane Florence. https://www.wect.com/2019/07/17/opportunity-zones-wilmington-explores-potential-benefits-hopes-connect-investors-projects/ …

Had the opportunity yesterday in a @HouseAgGOP subcommittee hearing to take an in-depth look at our livestock and poultry economies, and how passage of the #USMCA deal will benefit North Carolina farmers. #NC07 https://youtu.be/INMk4a28bPc
A well-deserved honor for the dedicated men and women of the @NewHanoverSO! https://twitter.com/NewHanoverSO/status/1148590424371728384 …

Had the chance to talk with Catchie McDonald, a 13-year-old from Wilmington with Type 1 diabetes in DC with @JDRFCoastalCaro and other #T1DChampions to share her story of life with #type1diabetes pic.twitter.com/I8V5Rdiff2
